channel.title: Troubleshooting on Hurst Systems
channel.description: Recent content in Troubleshooting on Hurst Systems

item.title: TroubleShooting a Users HomeDrive Auto-Remapping
item.description: Issue: Four users report that their ‘HomeDrive’ mapping is defaulting to Z:\ during login. Desktop Team reports that even after mapping and remapping the drive to N:\ within windows the drive reverts back to Z:\ Active Directory Users and Computers shows that the ‘HomeDrive’ set to N:\ on the profile tab of the AD User Object Desktop Team suspects that a GPO is making changes to the drive mappings for these users.
